name: Germany
notes: EU Blue Card is very attractive. Fast path to PR. Gateway to entire EU. No tuition for public universities.

visa_types.name: EU Blue Card
visa_types.description: Premium work visa for highly qualified professionals. Best option for tech workers.
requirements: Job offer with minimum salary €45,300 (€41,041 for shortage occupations)
The job must match your qualification
visa_types.path_to_pr: 21 months with B1 German, 33 months without
tips: IT/Tech jobs are shortage occupations (lower salary threshold)
Can move to another EU country after 18 months
Learn basic German for faster PR

visa_types.name: Skilled Immigration Act Visa
visa_types.description: For skilled workers with vocational training or work experience.
requirements: Recognized qualification or 2+ years relevant experience
tips: Experience can substitute for formal degrees

visa_types.name: Job Seeker Visa
visa_types.description: 6-month visa to search for employment in Germany.
requirements: No work allowed on this visa
visa_types.path_to_pr: Find job → Convert to work visa → PR path
tips: Good option if no job offer yet
Use time to network and interview
Can convert to Blue Card once employed

visa_types.name: Student Visa
visa_types.description: Study at German universities (many are tuition-free).
requirements: Proof of funds (€11,208/year in blocked account)
visa_types.duration: Length of study + 18 months job search
visa_types.path_to_pr: Graduate → 18 months job search → Blue Card → PR
visa_types.work_hours_limit: 120 full days or 240 half days per year
